column4: Windows is a bit of a strange beast in that there are very few applications on the platform that seem "native".
Yeah, Fedora is okay now that they finally caught up with a halfway-decent package manager
But the upgrade process still kind of sucks
It's basically "back up, flatten, install new version"
Certainly less convenient than apt-get dist-upgrade
Yeah, SuSE 7.3 was my first distro
Though in hindsight there wasn't much reason for me to use it since I basically jumped in the deep end after installing it anyway
Three days in I had a custom-compiled kernel and I had recompiled KDE for anti-aliased fonts
Breaking damn near my entire system in the process but it was a learning experience :)
I'm more excited about Cairo/Glitz hopefully not making GTK+ stupidly slow
i'm excited about the whole stack
I don't think you've ever touched Internet Explorer's box model
correct, you avoid that which is a: wrong and b: doesn't work
People like you are why the world doesn't take Linux and its users seriously. Drop the zealotry, and we'll continue this conversation. Otherwise, goodbye.
on the other hand, people like me drop cross browser websites out that work everywhere, and clients love us
indeedy, i wish itwere otherwise and we could drop the tables forever
